vulnerabilities.name: Apache Log4j2 Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (Log4Shell)
vulnerabilities.description: Apache Log4j2 versions 2.0-beta9 through 2.14.1 are vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) where an attacker with permission to modify the logging configuration file can construct a malicious configuration using a JDBC Appender with a data source referencing a JNDI URI which can execute remote code. This issue is known as Log4Shell.
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability in Apache Log4j2.
vulnerabilities.plugin_output: Apache Log4j2 version 2.14.1 detected on port 8080

vulnerabilities.name: Microsoft Outlook Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: Microsoft Outlook is vulnerable to a privilege escalation attack where an attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted email to a victim. Exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to access a user's Net-NTLMv2 hash which could be used as a basis of an NTLM relay attack against another service to authenticate as the user.
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote Windows host is affected by a privilege escalation vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.name: curl SOCKS5 Heap Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.description: This flaw makes curl overflow a heap based buffer in the SOCKS5 proxy handshake. When curl is asked to pass along the hostname to the SOCKS5 proxy to allow that to resolve the address instead of it getting done by curl itself, the maximum length that hostname can be is 255 bytes.
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host has a version of curl that is affected by a heap buffer overflow vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.name: GNU C Library Buffer Overflow in ld.so
vulnerabilities.description: A buffer overflow was discovered in the GNU C Library's dynamic loader ld.so while processing the GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variable. This flaw could allow a local attacker to use maliciously crafted GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variables when launching binaries with SUID permission to execute code with elevated privileges.
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host is affected by a buffer overflow vulnerability in glibc.

vulnerabilities.name: Linux Kernel Netfilter Use-After-Free
vulnerabilities.description: In the Linux kernel through 6.3.1, a use-after-free in Netfilter nf_tables when processing batch requests can be abused to perform arbitrary read and write operations on kernel memory. Unprivileged local users can obtain root privileges.
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote Linux kernel is affected by a use-after-free vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.name: Windows Common Log File System Driver Elevation of Privilege
vulnerabilities.description: Windows Common Log File System Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain SYSTEM privileges.
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote Windows host is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability.
